    • Constructor Detail

      • ModDetect_SVM

        public ModDetect_SVM(java.io.File[] modifierLexicons,
                     boolean[] modifierDetectionSettings,
                     java.io.File[] trainingFiles,
                     Corpus handAnnotatedTweetsCorpus,
                     double eps,
                     double C)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads modifier lexicons.
        Parameters:
        modifierLexicons - Array that contains the negation, intensifier and diminisher lexicon.
        modifierDetectionSettings - Says which modifier types are supposed to be considered.
        trainingFiles - Files containing the training data for the three SVM.
        handAnnotatedTweetsCorpus - Corpus that contains all Tweets for which hand annotations exist.
        eps - Stopping criteria.
        C - Costs of constraint violation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws exception if the lexicons can not be read.

    • Method Detail

      • annotateSVM

        public void annotateSVM(java.util.ArrayList<Tweet> corpus)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Annotates negation scopes using three binary SVM, one for each modifier type.
        Parameters:
        corpus - The to be annotated corpus.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws exception if the training data is corrupt.

      • annotateModifierCues

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> annotateModifierCues(java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokenList)
        Annotates the modifier cues of the present token list.
        Parameters:
        tokenList - The to be annotated token list
        Returns:
        Returns Returns an array list for each modifier type containing modifier cue indices.

      • predict

        private void predict(java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokenList,
                     int currentTokenIndex,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> modifierTokensIndices,
                     java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.util.CoreMap> sentences)
        Predicts the class of the presented token. Uses three binary SVM to determine if the token is either negated, intesified or diminished.
        Parameters:
        tokenList - Token list that contains the to be annotated token.
        currentTokenIndex - Index in the token list of the to be annotated token.
        modifierTokensIndices - ArrayList that contains the indices of all modifier cues.
        sentences - The sentences created and annotated by CoreNLP. Contains the dependency graph for each sentence of the Tweet containing the current to be annotated token.

      • createFeatureNodes

        private de.bwaldvogel.liblinear.FeatureNode[] createFeatureNodes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> modTokens,
                                                                 int currentTokenIndex,
                                                                 java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokenList,
                                                                 java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.util.CoreMap> sentences)
        Creates the features for the presented token. Features: normalized token string, POS of the token, POS of the first and second order parent, distance to the next modifier cue from the token itself and from the first and second order parent in the dependency graph, the left and right distance from the token to the next modifier cue in the sentence.
        Parameters:
        modTokens - List of the modifier cue indices.
        currentTokenIndex - Index of the token for which the features will be created.
        tokenList - Token list containing the token in concern.
        sentences - The sentences created and annotated by CoreNLP. Contains the dependency graph for each sentence of the Tweet containing the token in concern.
        Returns:
        Returns an array containing all feature nodes for the present token.

      • trainSVM

        private de.bwaldvogel.liblinear.Model[] trainSVM()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a model for each of our three SVM using the training data.
        Returns:
        Returns the models for our three SVM.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws exception of the training files are corrupt.

      • findBestC

        private double findBestC(de.bwaldvogel.liblinear.Problem problem,
                         de.bwaldvogel.liblinear.SolverType solver,
                         int modifierType,
                         java.io.File trainingFile,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Tweet> tweets,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> trainDataTweetIDs)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        problem - Problem for which the best C shall be found.
        solver - Selected solver to solve this problem.
        modifierType - Indicates the modifier type. (1 = negator, 2 = intensifier, 3 = diminisher)
        trainingFile - File containing the training data.
        tweets - HashMap containing all Tweets with their corresponding Tweet ID as the key.
        trainDataTweetIDs - Stores the Tweet ID and token index of each annotation.
        Returns:
        Returns the best value for the parameter C.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws exception if the training data is corrupt.

      • sortFeatureNodes

        private de.bwaldvogel.liblinear.FeatureNode[] sortFeatureNodes(de.bwaldvogel.liblinear.FeatureNode[] featureNodes)
        Sorts a feature nodes array ascending by feature index (required by liblinear)
        Parameters:
        featureNodes - To be sorted feature nodes array
        Returns:
        Returns sorted feature nodes array

      • createHashMap

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Tweet> createHashMap()
        Creates a HashMap containing all Tweets from the 'handAnnotatedTweetsCorpus' with their corresponding TweetID as the key. This allows to easily retrieve a Tweet object with its ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a HashMap containing all Tweets from the 'handAnnotatedTweetsCorpus' with their corresponding TweetID as the key.
